result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey L. McKnight was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Casey L. McKnight in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts. State moved to delete the enhancer.   Court dismissed the domestic abuse enhancer.  Court advised DE as to his right to an Atty.  Defendant does not wish to have an atty.  Court finds he has freely waived his right to an Atty.  DE entered G plea.  Court finds defendant guilty.  

Court:  Costs $443.00 given 60 dtp or set up payment plan - 1 year from today if no further criminal charges court will expunge record he needs to apply

Defendant Casey L. McKnight in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, wishes to contact counsel.  Court enters NG Plea.  DEF temporarily waives right to Counsel, to speak to DA office.   Bond Continues.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
